moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 Nf6 3. cxd5 Nxd5 4. e4 Nf: Standard stuff, so far. Now that both players have castled, we can embark on complications.
moves.8... Bxc3 9. bxc3: A simple exchange is the opening salvo.
moves.9... b6 10. Re1: I hope to be able to exploit my central Pawns.
moves.11... Nbd7 12. Nxd7: Rather than retreat, I swap down.
moves.13... Re8 14. Qf3: No specific threats, but on principle it's always good to aim your pieces at the other player's King.
moves.14... Nf8 15. Qh3: Repositioning, with the thought of a possible future mate at KR7 in mind, although no specific plan to accomplish that.
moves.15... g6 16. f4: May as well try to open up Black's defenses...
moves.16... Qf6 17. Ref1: Nothing specific in mind, but there's always the possibility of a discovered attack on the KB file...
moves.17... Red8 18. f5: Time to pry open the Black defenses some.
moves.21... Qxc3 22. Bxf8: Ooops. Gave up a free Pawn.
moves.22... Qxa1+ 23. Rf1: Another blunder. Overlooked the fall of my Rook. Oh well, life goes on.
moves.23... Qxd4+ 24. Kh1: Practically forced... but now my Bishop will fall as well. I should probably resign...
moves.24... Qxd3 25. Qe6+: H'mm, what's this? Black's King is exposed...
moves.25... Kh8 26. Qf6+: Well, look at that! I've got...
